search-placeholder: Search Title, Artist, Series, Language or Tags
carousel-title: Click to show archives from the current search with the specified filter
thumbnail-crop: If enabled, thumbnails that don't fit a regular A4 page will be cropped to only show the left side.
title: Title
json-error-main: I don't know everything, but I sure as hell know this database's busted lads
json-error-sub: The database cache is corrupt, and as such LANraragi is unable to display your archive list.

default_password_warning.heading: You're using the default password and that's super baka of you
default_password_warning.text:
Login with password "kamimamita" and change that shit on the double.
...Or just disable it!
Why not check the configuration options afterwards, while you're at it?

contextMenuHelp: If you want to perform advanced operations on an archive, remember to just right-click its name. Happy reading!

debug_mode_message.heading: You're running in Debug Mode!
debug_mode_message.text: Advanced server statistics can be viewed here.

CustomColumn.Title: Enter a tag namespace for this column
CustomColumn.Text:
Enter a full namespace without the colon, e.g "artist".
If you have multiple tags with the same namespace, only the last one will be shown in the column.

new_version.heading: A new version of LANraragi ({{tag_name}}) is available!
new_version.text: Click here to check it out.

errorGettingChangelog: Error getting changelog for new version
noCategory: This archive isn't in any category.

ContextMenu.Text: Are you sure you want to delete this archive?

clickHereToDisplay: Click here to display the archives contained in this category.
migration_heading: Your Reading Progression is now saved on the server!
migration_text: You seem to have some local progression hanging around -- Please wait warmly while we migrate it to the server for you. ☕
migration_success_heading: Reading Progression has been fully migrated! 🎉
migration_success_text: You'll have to reopen archives in the Reader to see the migrated progression values.
select_category: Select a category to show the matching settings.
tags_and_thumbnails: Tags and Thumbnails
siteDescription: The site title appears on most pages as...their title.
motdDescription: Slang for Message of the Day. Appears on top of the main Library view.
languageDescription: Choose the language for the user interface. Save and return to the library to take effect.
archivesPerPageDescription: Number of archives shown on a page in the main list.
resizeImagesDescription: If enabled, pages exceeding a certain size will be resized when viewed to save bandwidth.
resizeImagesWarning: This option can potentially consume a lot of RAM if enabled and used on large images! Use with caution.
imageSizeThresholdDescription: (in KBs.) Maximum size an image can reach before being resized.
resizeQualityDescription: Quality of the resized images. Less quality = Smaller image. (0-100)
clientsideProgress1: Enabling this option will save reading progression on the browser (through localStorage) instead of the server.
clientsideProgress2: Consider toggling this option if you're sharing the LANraragi instance with multiple users!
debugModeDescription: Enabling Debug Mode will show more logs and disable update nagging. Fully effective after restarting LANraragi.
cleanDatabaseDescription: Cleaning the database will remove entries that aren't on your filesystem.
resetDatabaseWarning2: Clicking this button will reset the entire database and delete all settings and metadata.
config-theme-1: The selected theme will apply to the entire application and be shown to all users.
config-theme-2: If you're using a browser that supports 'theme-color', the theme's primary color will also be applied there.
config-theme-3: Click on a theme to preview it before saving!
passwordDescription: If enabled, everything that isn't reading will require a password.
passwordfields1: Only edit these fields if you want to change your password.
passwordfields2: The one already stored will be used otherwise.
nofunmodefields1: Enabling No-Fun Mode will lock reading archives behind the password as well.
config_apikey:
If you wish to use the Client API and have a password, you'll have to set a key here.
Empty keys will not work!
This key will need to be provided in every protected API call as the Authorization header.
enable_cors: Enable CORS for the Client API
enablecorsfields1: Have API requests support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing, which allows web browsers to access it off other domains.
enablecorsfields2: Turn this on if you want to access this service through a web-based wrapper (e.g. a userscript) used/hosted on another domain.
dirHint: Directory where the archives will be located. It will be created if it doesn't exist.
osUserHint: Make sure the OS user running LANraragi has read access to this directory.
synoCompatHint: If enabled, LANraragi will cutoff archive filenames to 143 bytes, which is the max accepted by eCryptFS.
rescanButtonHint:
Click this button to trigger a rescan of the Archive Directory in case you're missing files, 
 or some data such as total page counts.
tempFolderHint:
In MBs. The temporary folder contains recently opened archives, for faster subsequent reading. 
 It is automatically emptied when it grows past this specified size.
cleanTempHint: Empty the temporary folder manually by clicking this button.
cacheHint:
The last searches done in the archive index are cached for faster loads.
 If something went wrong with said cache, you can reset it by clicking this button.
newFlagHint: Newly uploaded archives are marked as 'new' in the index until you've opened them. If you want to clear those flags, click this button.
replaceDupeHint:
If enabled, LANraragi will overwrite old archives when a newer one (with the same name) is uploaded through the Web Uploader or the Download System.
This will delete metadata for old files when they're replaced! Use with caution.
thumbnailDirectoryDescription: Directory where the archive thumbnails will be located. It will be created if it doesn't exist. Make sure the OS user running LANraragi has read/write access to this directory.
useHighQualityThumbnailsDescription: LANraragi generates lower-quality thumbnails for archive pages for performance reasons. If this option is checked, it will instead generate page thumbnails at the same quality as cover thumbnails.
useJPEGXLForThumbnailsDescription: LANraragi generates JPEG thumbnails for compatibility and performance reasons. If this option is checked, it will instead generate thumbnails using JPEG XL.
generateMissingThumbnailsButtonDescripti: Generate Thumbnails for all archives that don't have one yet.
regenerateAllThumbnailsButtonDescription: Regenerate all thumbnails. This might take a while!
addTimestampTagDescription: If enabled, LANraragi will add the UNIX timestamp of the current time as a tag under the 'date_added' namespace to newly added archives.
useLastModifiedTimeDescription: Enabling this will use file modified time instead of current time when setting 'date_added' timestamps.
tagRulesDescription:
When tagging archives using Plugins, the rules specified here will be applied to the tags before saving them to the database.
Split rules with linebreaks.
-tag | tag : removes the tag (like a blacklist)
-namespace:* : removes all tags within this namespace
~namespace : strips the namespace from the tags
tag -> new-tag : replaces one tag
tag => new-tag : replaces one tag, but use a hash table internally for faster performance. These rules will be executed once after all other rules.
namespace:* -> new-namespace:* : replaces the namespace with the new one
shinobu_ok:
The Shinobu File Watcher is currently

👍 OK!
shinobu_ko:
The Shinobu File Watcher is currently

👹 Kaput!
shinobu_description: This File Watcher is responsible for monitoring your content directory and automatically handling new archives as they come.
restart_description: If Shinobu is dead or unresponsive, you can reboot her by clicking this button.
minion_description:
The Minion Worker handles spare tasks that are too long to execute within the request/response lifecycle of web applications.
The console shows currently running and concluded tasks.

dataTable.infoEmpty: No archives to show you! Try uploading some?

login.page-requires-login: This page requires you to log on.

logs.title: Application Logs
logs.description: You can check LANraragi logs here for debugging purposes. By default, this view only shows the last 100 lines of each logfile, newest lines last.
logs.general_info: General Logs pertain to the main application.
logs.shinobu_info: Shinobu Logs correspond to the Background Worker.
logs.plugin_info: Plugin Logs are reserved for metadata plugins only.
logs.mojo_info: Mojolicious logs won't tell much unless you're running Debug Mode.
logs.redis_info: Redis logs won't be available from here if you're running from source!

edit.title: Title:
edit.plugin-warning: Using a Plugin will save any modifications to archive metadata you might have made!

upload.title: Adding Archives to the Library
upload.description: Add files to your LANraragi instance from your computer, or the Internet directly.
upload.drag_drop: You can drag and drop files into this window, or click the upload button.
upload.download_description: You can download files from remote URLs directly into LANraragi.
upload.download_jobs: Download jobs will keep going even if you close this window!
upload.type_urls: Type in your URLs (separated by a newline), and click the download button.
upload.downloader_plugin: If a Downloader plugin is compatible with the URL, it'll be automatically used.

stats.asking-for-tag-statistics: Asking the great powers that be for your tag statistics...
stats.tags-appear-twice: (These statistics only show tags that appear at least twice in your database.)

category.title: Categories
category.description: Categories appear at the top of your window when browsing the Library.
category.static: Static Categories are arbitrary collections of Archives, where you can add as many items as you want.
category.dynamic: Dynamic Categories contain all archives matching a given predicate, and automatically update alongside your library.
category.create_new: You can create new categories here or edit existing ones.
category.select_to_edit: Select a category in the combobox below to edit its name, the archives it contains, or its predicate.
category.auto_save: All your modifications are saved automatically.
category.static_placeholder: If you select a Static Category, your archives will appear here so you can add/remove them from the category.

batch.title: Batch Operations
batch.description: You can apply modifications to multiple archives in one go here.
batch.instructions: Select what you'd like to do, check archives you want to use it on, and get rolling!
batch.prechecked: Archives with no tags have been pre-checked.
batch.cooldown_recommendation: This plugin recommends a cooldown of
batch.apply_tag_rules_description: This will apply the following Tag Rules to the selected Archives.
batch.edit_tag_rules: You can edit your Tag Rules in Server Configuration.
batch.remove_new_flag_description: This removes the "new" flag from the selected archives.
batch.delete_warning: This will delete both metadata and matching files from your system! Please use with caution.

plugins.title: Plugin Configuration
plugins.enable_disable_auto_plugin: Enable/Disable Auto-Plugin on metadata plugins by checking the toggles.
plugins.auto_use_new_archives: Plugins will be automatically used on new archives if they're toggled here.
plugins.set_configuration_variables: If they have configuration variables, you can set them here as well.
plugins.trigger_scripts: You can also trigger Scripts here. Triggering a script will save your Plugin settings beforehand.
plugins.allow_replace_titles: Allow Plugins to replace archive titles:
plugins.metadata_plugins_change_titles: If enabled, metadata plugins will be able to change the title of your archives alongside adding tags to them.
plugins.depends_on_login_plugin: This plugin depends on the login plugin
plugins.trigger_on_urls_matching: This plugin will trigger on URLs matching this regex!

reader.done-reading: Done reading? Go back to Archive Index
reader.navigation-help-toast: You can navigate between pages using:
reader.touching-image: Touching the left/right side of the image.
reader.bring-up-thumbnail-index: Q: bring up the thumbnail index and archive options.
reader.return-to-archive-index: To return to the archive index, touch the arrow pointing down or use Backspace.

backup.title: Database Backup/Restore
backup.description: You can backup your existing database here, or restore an existing backup.
backup.backup_info: Backuping allows you to download a JSON file containing all your categories and archive IDs, and their matching metadata.
backup.restore_info: Restoring from a backup will restore this metadata, for IDs which already exist in your database.
